definition: to sever all relations with sb/determined/decisive
to decide/to determine/to execute (sb)/(of a dam etc) to breach or burst/definitely/certainly
to cut short/extinct/to disappear/to vanish/absolutely/by no means

sentences.english: Ms Blears pointedly refused to say a good word about the prime minister as she resigned.
sentences.chinese: 她在離任時曾很決絕的拒絕對首相發表一句讚美之詞。

sentences.english: Seven steps if you don't return, I would refuse to go.
sentences.chinese: 七步之內你若不回，我就決絕而去。

sentences.english: If you refuse to take risk, you can’t have better returns.
sentences.chinese: 如果你決絕承擔風險，你就不能獲得很高的回報。

definition: to be softhearted/to be tenderhearted/to be kindhearted
honor does not allow one to glance back (idiom); duty-bound not to turn back/no surrender/to pursue justice with no second thoughts
to be in a tangle/to nag
lit. wading in mud and water/a slovenly job/sloppy
the moth flies into the flame/fatal attraction
to resign oneself to adversity (idiom); to grin and bear it/to submit meekly to insults, maltreatment, humiliation etc
to grieve/to be broken-hearted/to feel deeply hurt
to intertwine/to band together (with)/to link up (with)/twisted/tangled/confused/to be at a loss
helpless/without choice/for lack of better option/grudgingly/willy-nilly/nolens volens/abbr. for 無可奈何|无可奈何[wu2 ke3 nai4 he2]
to feel sad/to feel unwell/(of life) to be difficult
